Introduction¶

RequestSession is an HTTP library built on top of requests that makes your life easier by retrying failed requests, loging the results or even sends metrics to DataDogHQ. RequestSession can also measure the time of requests.

Use RequestSession to create a client module for accessing a group of resources served on a common endpoint with default values valid for all or most of the calls you need to make. For your convenience, some defaults are already provided.

Installation¶

request_session can be installed using pip install request-session.

Basic Usage¶

from request_session import RequestSession

client = RequestSession(
    host="https://jobs.kiwi.com",
    max_retries=4,                  # how many times to retry in case server error occurs
    raise_for_status=True,          # raise an error if failed on every attempt
)

response = client.get(
    path="/",
    sleep_before_repeat=1,      # how long to wait untill next try
    tags=["get:jobs.kiwi.com"], # tags to send to DataDogHQ
    request_category="jobs",    # what to log to stdout/stderr
)
